docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 In a move long favored by the drug industry and some physicians, the Food and Drug Administration has ordered an audit of the basic data from a major study that showed pills widely used by diabetics did not benefit the patients and were probably hazardous.

headline.main: AUDIT IS ORDERED ON DIABETES DATA; F.D.A. Calls for Review of Basic Information Used in Study of Oral Drugs

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 In a move long favored by the drug industry and some physicians, the Food and Drug Administration has ordered an audit of the basic data from a major study that showed pills widely used by diabetics did not benefit the patients...

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr. Special to The New York Times
